revised_title: Surface Films' Role in Oxygen Evolution Kinetics at Pd + Au Alloy Electrodes
tldr: The authors studied the kinetics of anodic oxygen evolution at Pd, Au, and their alloys in acid and alkaline solutions. They demonstrated the role of barrier-layer films in determining the kinetic behavior and provided self-consistent interpretations of the Tafel slopes and e.m.f. decay observed on open-circuit. The findings contribute to understanding the mechanisms of electrochemical reactions at alloy electrodes.
